title: Roman Empire: Government and Legal System

vocab.definition: Government where power rests with citizens and elected representatives
Assembly of nobles that advised Roman magistrates
Chief executive officer of the Roman Republic
Legal system that influenced modern legal codes
Legal status granting rights and responsibilities

teachingNotes: Focus on Roman contributions to government and law. Compare Roman republic to modern democratic systems.

sample.question: What is a government where power rests with citizens and representatives?
What was the chief executive of the Roman Republic?
What legal system influenced modern codes?
What is legal status granting rights?
What did the Roman Republic have?

truefalse.question: The consul was the chief executive officer of the Roman Republic. (True or False)
A republic has no elected representatives. (True or False)
The senate advised Roman magistrates. (True or False)
Roman law influenced modern legal systems. (True or False)
Citizenship granted no rights. (True or False)
Power in a republic rests with citizens. (True or False)
The senate was an assembly of nobles. (True or False)
Consuls were not executives. (True or False)
Roman law created legal codes. (True or False)

multiplechoice.question: What was the chief executive called?
What is a government with elected representatives?

shortanswer.question: What is a republic?
expectedAny: Government where power rests with citizens and elected representatives
System with elected leaders representing citizens

shortanswer.question: What was the Roman senate?
expectedAny: Assembly of nobles that advised Roman magistrates
Group of nobles providing government advice

shortanswer.question: What did consuls do?
expectedAny: Chief executive officers of the Roman Republic

shortanswer.question: What is Roman law?
expectedAny: Legal system that influenced modern legal codes
Foundation of many modern legal systems

shortanswer.question: What is citizenship?
expectedAny: Legal status granting rights and responsibilities
Membership in community with rights and duties
Status providing legal protections and obligations

shortanswer.question: How did the republic work?
expectedAny: Citizens elected representatives who held power
Power shared between citizens and elected officials

shortanswer.question: Why were consuls important?
expectedAny: They led government with executive authority
Top officials who administered the republic

shortanswer.question: How did Roman law influence us?
expectedAny: Provided foundation for modern legal systems
Many current laws based on Roman principles
Created legal concepts still used today

shortanswer.question: What did citizens gain?
expectedAny: Rights to participate and legal protection with responsibilities
Political and legal rights plus civic duties
Ability to vote and legal protections
